com.elsevier.spark_xml_utils.xpath

Class XPathProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.elsevier.spark_xml_utils.xpath.XPathProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class XPathProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class with methods to filter an XPath expression (return a TRUE/FALSE) against a string of arbitrary xml content and evaluate an XPath expression (return a serialized response) against a string of arbitrary xml content.
    Author:
    Darin McBeath
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • filterString

        public boolean filterString(java.lang.String content)
                     throws XPathException
        Filter the content with the XPath expression specified when creating the XPathProcessor.
        Parameters:
        content - String to which the XPath expression will be applied
        Returns:
        TRUE if the XPath expression evaluates to true, FALSE otherwise
        Throws:
        XPathException

      • evaluateString

        public java.lang.String evaluateString(java.lang.String content)
                                throws XPathException
        Evaluate the content with the XPath expression specified when creating the XPathProcessor and return a serialized response.
        Parameters:
        content - String to which the XPath Expression will be evaluated
        Returns:
        Serialized response from the evaluation.
        Throws:
        XPathException
